discourse_list.title: Vitalik on Maker governance: outlast rather than outmanoeuvre

content.content: Screen Shot 2022-07-09 at 12.27.47 PM1210×1144 195 KB  Interesting to think how this model of thinking would map onto the Endgame Plan / MetaDAOs / the ‘dove v hawk’ debate. For instance, is distributing power to a range of MetaDAOs a means of outlasting the competition (by solidifying the Maker core and spreading risk elsewhere) or outmaneuvering it with more nimble units?
content.GPT-summary: The post discusses Vitalik's thoughts on Maker governance and how it could apply to other debates such as the 'dove v hawk' debate. The author is not asking for feedback or advertising the proposal. A 3rd party is not giving entirely positive or negative feedback, but rather asking questions and providing constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
